Brainlet here. Is there a way to mute an entire board like you can mute users with [M]?
We are the few, the proud, the brave.

>>1957861b-ca5f-4894-9fef-38cdabbf51ea
Doesn't this open us up to an attack whereby the enemy overwhelms the network with heavily seeding nodes to make it very difficult to connect to an "uncensored" node?

What we have is probably okay for now, but it might not scale or be vulnerable to attack. Long term some kind of blockchain solution like OP suggested will probably be necessary.
Full disclosure, I hold BTC, BCH and BSV **but I'm not telling you faggots what the ratio is**

>>0848438e-fb40-476d-8a71-ad25c57f9127
>Illegal opinions
Maybe in the shithole you live in.

Like a lot of other anons here, I would love for this shit to be true, but I find it difficult to believe.

Answer me this: if a safe method for telling the IRS to fuck off for good really exists, why hasn't any major lawyer or law firm advertised that they can get non-federal employees off the hook and made a small fortune? I would pay a king's ransom to a lawyer/accountant who would actually stake their career on freeing me from the bondage of being a tax cow for these evil monsters, but the fact that nobody has come out and staked their career or reputation on the method you describe doesn't make sense if it actually works 100%.

I'm sure I could play back and forth with the IRS for several years to prevent them from taking my shit, but what guarantee do I have that after years of aggravation and worrying they won't just confiscate my property and lock me away anyway. If you have any substantial assets in the US its just not worth the risk IMO.

Again, I sympathize with what you're trying to do here, OP, but I need more proof than just a bunch of stories about stalling the IRS indefinitely with letters their tiny brains can't process and a few refund checks. I don't doubt that this method might succeed for some people under certain circumstances. They can't catch everyone, after all, and if you make yourself enough a nuisance and don't owe millions you probably have a good chance of being left alone, but what you have shown us so far here doesn't imply a 100% chance of being left alone.

>>d84f4fd0-ea50-44ca-8d18-3dacd93ba6b6
Exactly. The only reason anyone thinks federal agents are anything other than a bunch of a pathetic soyboys is because that's how they're portrayed in movies and TV by schlomo.
The reality is 99% of them (especially GenX or younger) are archetypal untermenchen which is why they ended up in such a pathetic line of work in the first place.

Here's your [M], OP
